desc: Wallet address and DAO token balance.

Current state of a proposal, following Compound's convention. Block number used to retrieve user's votes and quorum. As per Compound's Comp and OpenZeppelin's ERC20Votes, the snapshot is performed at the end of this block. Hence, voting for this proposal starts at the beginning of the following block. Block number at which votes close. Votes close at the end of this block, so it is possible to cast a vote during this block. https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/api/governance#IGovernor

Delegate votes from the sender to delegatee. By default, token balance does not account for voting power. This makes transfers cheaper. The downside is that it requires users to delegate to themselves in order to activate checkpoints and have their voting power tracked. https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/api/token/erc20#ERC20Votes
